title: How do you tell if someone is using your WiFi without permission?
self_text: I don't know what a router looks like, so can't check the number of devices connected to it. But I have noticed my internet has been slower than usual and sometimes I get logged out of websites for no reason.  I was wondering how to find out who is using my WiFi without permission.   Thanks.

title: Why is the phrase "you are what you eat" so popular?
self_text: I'm pretty sure that it has a scientific basis but I don't know why it became such a popular saying, and not any other saying like "you are how you sleep".

title: What’s the difference between a lightbulb and a lamp?
self_text: One has no plug and you screw it into something, the other has a plug and is a whole thing. But are they both lights or are they two different things entirely?

title: Why do people say "That's a weird flex, but okay?"
self_text: How did that even get started? What does it mean to be flexing?

title: Why is there so much hype around the new Marvel movie?
self_text: I don't understand why people are making such a big deal about it. It looks like a pretty average superhero movie to me.

title: Is it normal for a dog to hate the sound of fireworks?
self_text: I have a 5 year old poodle that loves to go on walks with me and is generally well behaved, but as soon as I get outside and hear even just the first bang from a firework he starts shaking like crazy and tries to run back inside. This happened last night and every time before that when there's been a fireworks show or something going off in the neighborhood.  I know they can be scary, but how common is it for dogs to get so scared by them that they start shaking?

title: Why does the Japanese government want people to have more babies?
self_text: The birth rate is declining and it’s a big problem for their economy and future, but why would they care about that? I thought the point of capitalism was to make money, so if there are fewer consumers then companies will just charge more. Is that not how capitalism works? Also, why do they think having more babies will solve anything? Wouldn't that only mean more competition in jobs or something?  I feel like there’s gotta be more than that.

title: What is a "Moe" anime character?
self_text: I'm looking for some recommendations on where to start when it comes to Anime, and someone said that my taste in characters would be more of the "moe" type.  I don't know what they mean by that, but they mentioned I should check out things like My Dress-Up Darling, Kaguya Sama Love Is War, Komi Can't Communicate and Oregairu. I do have some knowledge about anime (I've watched Cowboy Bebop, Death Note and Attack on Titan) so I'm not a total noob, but I still don't know what "moe" means.  So what exactly does it mean to be a "moe" anime character?

title: How does a dog know when they are getting old?
self_text: My dogs almost 14 and I think he's starting to get old. He doesn't play with his toys like he used to, and he sleeps more during the day.

title: Why do they call it a black box?
self_text: It's not even that mysterious, I mean you can find a lot of information on the internet about how these work, and why are they called boxes?  I thought they were long tubes.

title: Why are the olympics called the summer and winter games if it’s already summer or winter?
self_text: They should be called “the Summer Olympics” and “the Winter Olympics”.  But why do we call them “the summer/winter games”?

title: Why is the name of a brand always written as "[Brand Name] Inc."?
self_text: I'm seeing it everywhere and I just don't get why every company has to write "Inc" at the end of their names.  What does that even mean, how do they decide what companies are an inc, how can you create an inc for your business etc.

title: What is the difference between a dog and cat person?
self_text: Like, what makes people like cats or dogs more than each other? I personally love both but think dogs are kinda better because they're more loyal to their owners (no offense to any cat lovers).

title: How do you remove a sticker from glass?
self_text: I have a sticker on my window and when i try to peel it off, the adhesive stays behind.  I tried using a razor blade but that didn't work either.  Is there anything else i can use?

title: What is the deal with dogs eating grass?
self_text: I’m not a dog owner but my friend's dog will eat grass even though he has food. Is there something wrong with him or is it normal for them to do that?  I’ve heard if they vomit after, they have a stomach bug but what if they don’t? Is it still bad?   Edit: Thank you all for your help! I really appreciate it. It seems like most of you are saying it’s normal and nothing to worry about as long as he doesn’t start doing it often.   I’ll be sure to ask my friend to take him to the vet if anything changes. Thanks again!

title: How does the company/person who owns a sports team (NFL, NBA, etc) make money?
self_text: I get that they make money from TV deals and merchandise but is it really enough to cover all of the expenses associated with running a professional sports team like player salaries, stadium maintenance, travel costs, etc.? If so then how much do the owners actually make in revenue after all these expenses are accounted for?  And if not then where does the rest of the money come from? Do they take out loans or have other investors help them foot the bill or something along those lines?

title: What are the differences between a cat and dog?
self_text: I'm a first time pet owner and considering getting either a dog or cat but would like to know what makes each of them different from the other, what can they do that the other cant or dont do, their strengths and weaknesses etc.  I understand it comes down to personal preference but as i said i don't have any experience with pets so I am going into this blind.

title: Why is a dog named "Lucky" always unlucky?
self_text: Every time I see a dog named Lucky, it's either very sick or has some other kind of disability.  I know that sounds weird but every single time I hear the name it's for a special needs dog. It's kinda sad tbh. Does anyone else notice this pattern?

title: How do you stop a dog from eating grass?
self_text: My dog loves to eat grass and it makes me worried he's sick or something but I've asked my vet about it before and they said it's normal for dogs to do that sometimes. Is there anything I can do to discourage him though, as I worry he might get worms?

title: Why does the internet not remember anything?
self_text: I'm talking about the old posts and comments that are now lost forever.  Like people used to post on forums like Reddit or Tumblr, but it seems like a lot of these things have disappeared over time. Even if they haven't been deleted by mods, they're just gone because nobody has saved them. Is there something we can do to prevent this from happening?

title: How do I tell my family that the dog is starting to show signs of aging?
self_text: He's 12 and a half, he has gray hairs around his muzzle and gets tired quicker.  I want them to know so they don't expect him to be able to walk for an hour like he used to but I don't wanna make it sound like he's dying or anything.

title: Why is a rocket called a firework when it isn't a work of fire?
self_text: I know that the word "fire" means flames and a firework shoots out flames, but rockets don't shoot out fire. They shoot out exhaust from the burning fuel which creates the propulsion needed to lift off.  I think it makes sense to call them a blast or explosion, because they explode to launch into space. I suppose its more historical than anything though.  I guess people used to use gunpowder in fireworks as well so thats why.

title: What does it mean to "be in the zone"?
self_text: I've heard people say they were "in the zone" but don't know what it means, is it like when you focus on a task and just do really good at that task?

title: How to deal with a very loud dog that won't stop barking?
self_text: My neighbour has a dog and he doesn't stop barking so I can't sleep or do anything, it's really annoying as he barks for hours on end. I have tried speaking to my neighbour but they don't seem to care about the issue and said its normal for dogs to bark and if i didn't like it I should move. I would love to know what are some options in dealing with this situation as I'm not willing to move due to the reasons below.  *I've lived here for many years *I recently got into a new job after being unemployed for 2 years *The area is great for transport, shops etc   Are there any laws regarding noise pollution or excessive dog barking? Should I contact the council or police? Is there anything else I could try before contacting them? Any help would be appreciated.

title: Why is it called a “hot dog” when it’s neither hot nor a dog?
self_text: I know that it came from Germany with the word dachshund, but why did they rename it to a hot dog?  Did people think that if you ate a whole dachshund then you'd be really strong and athletic like them?  Or what?

title: What is the difference between a comet and a meteor?
self_text: I know what they both are but not what makes them different. Both seem to be rocks in space that burn up when entering Earth’s atmosphere, so why do we call one thing a meteor and another a comet? Is it their speed or size? Or something else entirely? And can a meteor turn into a comet, or vice versa?  Thanks!

title: What's the deal with "I am a simple man" memes?
self_text: I don’t get them, they seem to be used for everything but what is the point of it?

title: Why is it always the best product that doesn't get advertised?
self_text: For example, I found out about the amazing brand of peanut butter on a YouTube video from a guy who says he has tried every single brand in the US and abroad. It turns out this peanut butter is super popular in other countries but nobody in the US knows about it because they don't advertise.  I also learned about an absolutely delicious hot sauce from the same person for the same reason.   Why do the companies with the best products not want to advertise? Is it just because their product sells itself through word of mouth? Or maybe advertising isn't as important anymore?

title: What's the point of having a dog that can only sit and stay?
self_text: I have a friend who has a husky but they won't train it because they like how cute it looks when it gets in trouble, so he'll just lay on the floor or run around like crazy and then my friend will go "no no" at him.  I thought the whole point was to teach them stuff like come here, fetch, roll over etc. Is there something wrong with their way of thinking or do some people just don't care about teaching their dogs anything?

title: How do I get rid of a smell in the apartment?
self_text: It's like an old smell, and it only seems to come out when it rains or there's high humidity.  I've tried everything. I used dryer sheets under the bed for months, Febreze everywhere, spray bottles filled with vinegar, baking soda everywhere, air fresheners, nothing works! It just doesn't go away.  My landlord says he can't find anything wrong. He sprayed some stuff on the carpet but it didn't help either. Is this something that will eventually go away on its own? Or am I stuck smelling old lady for eternity?  Also, does anyone know what causes these smells? I feel like it might be mold or mildew, maybe even a dead animal, but my landlord said he checked already.

title: How does the phrase "I'm in charge" work?
self_text: I can never quite tell if people are being serious when they say it, and/or what they mean by it. It feels like a threat sometimes, or that they're trying to intimidate me.  Is there some history behind it? Is it from military or police?  And how do you react to someone who says that?  Like if your boss said that, would you feel intimidated? If your friend said that, would you be worried? What about strangers saying that?  It seems weirdly aggressive for such a simple phrase.

title: Why does the US have a higher poverty rate than most other developed nations?
self_text: I read somewhere that in the USA, ~12% of people live in poverty while most developed countries are lower than that and why is it like that? I heard from my uncle that the US has more homeless people than all other countries combined but how can that be when there's only ~300 million people here compared to Europe which has over 700 million people living in it?  I know there's less social safety nets in the US so someone who loses their job will be far more likely to become homeless or go into debt as opposed to Germany where they may get unemployment benefits or healthcare etc... But even with those factors considered shouldn't the numbers still add up?   Is it because the USA is just more capitalistic than any other country and allows for greater wealth inequality? Or is it something else?

title: Is it illegal to give a dog human food?
self_text: I was told that if you feed your dog human food, the vets will report you for animal abuse.   Is this true?  I've never heard of such a thing but my mom swears its true.

title: How do I make a good salad?
self_text: So basically all the ingredients are in the fridge, now what???

title: Why do people say "that's so weird" when they mean it in a good way?
self_text: I hear people say "that's so weird" all the time, and almost always they mean it in a good way. What does that even mean?  I get why you would say something is weird if it is strange or unusual, but how did weird become a positive thing?

title: How do you change a flat tire on an electric scooter?
self_text: It's not the same as changing a bike tire because it doesn't have the inner tube that I could pull out and patch up, but how do you get the tire off of the wheel without damaging anything else?  I don't want to pay $100+ for someone to change it when all I need is a new tire which costs $30-$40.

title: Why are most anime protagonists guys?
self_text: I'm not a fan of anime, but it seems like all the protagonists are guys and there aren't many girls who have their own story and character arc. Is there any reason for that? (I think some people will say it's just easier to sell merchandise with male characters, but if so why is that?)

title: How to get rid of a bad smell from the fridge?
self_text: So I accidentally put an open can of soda in there and it leaked everywhere, so now everything smells like old soda even after cleaning it up multiple times.

title: How do you get rid of a bad smell in your car?
self_text: I have a car that smells like wet dog even though no dogs have been in it recently.  I've tried everything, including removing the seats and shampooing them, but nothing works!  Any ideas?

title: Why is it that you can't have a white background on any website?
self_text: It's so hard to find websites with just black text on a white background. All of them are either dark or light blue, green, pink etc. Is there some sort of reason for that?

title: How do you tell if your pet is sick?
self_text: My dog seems a bit more tired than usual and has been eating less of his food, but he still wants to go outside and play, so I don't know if it's anything serious or just a phase.   I can't take him to the vet because it's too expensive right now. Any advice on what to look for?  Thanks!

title: How do I get my cat to stop clawing at the furniture?
self_text: My cat is scratching up my couches, chairs and carpet.  I don't want to declaw him so how can I train him not to scratch furniture?  (Yes I bought a scratching post)

title: Why do some people use the term "post" when referring to a post on Reddit?
self_text: It’s not like it's literally in the mail or something, so why say “I posted” instead of “I made”? Or just simply saying I put up?  The first time I heard it was from my friend who is very active on Reddit and said “oh, did you see my post?” And I assumed it meant he mailed me something lol.

title: Why are the most powerful rockets only used for the most important missions?
self_text: I saw a video on YouTube that talked about how the Space Shuttle and Falcon Heavy have the highest thrust to weight ratio of all rockets ever built, but they are rarely used for anything other than sending payloads into GEO or beyond. Wouldn't it be cheaper/easier to just use these rockets for everything instead of having dozens of smaller rockets with lower thrust to weight ratios?

title: Why do people say "I'm a big fan of" but not "I'm a small fan of"?
self_text: I understand why people would say they are a huge fan or something like that, but why is it always just "big?"

title: How did Elon Musk get so much money?
self_text: He made millions with Paypal, then took that and created Tesla and SpaceX. But how does a company go from making $10 million to billions in just under two decades?  I know it's not simple but I would love an explanation of how he got to the point where he could buy Twitter.

title: What do you think of the name "Gideon"?
self_text: I'm looking for a baby boy name and I like the sound of Gideon but I'm not sure what people will think about it, as well as if it's too close to "Biden" since I live in America.  I don't want my son to be made fun of or confused with President Biden.

title: What is the difference between a ball and a sphere?
self_text: I understand that a ball has to have some sort of bounce or be able to roll, but what if it’s flat like a pancake? Is it still considered a ball?  Or does it have to be perfect? Like a basketball?

title: Is the sun a star?
self_text: I’m not trying to be that guy but i just want to know if it is or not  I thought it was and so did my class when asked today but then my friend said it isn’t :/

title: Is it possible to become a billionaire with only fans?
self_text: I've seen multiple people reach the millions but never billions so is it physically possible or am I wrong and someone has reached that milestone already?

title: How do I stop a dog from eating grass?
self_text: My dog likes to eat grass and sometimes throws up after he does, is there anything that can be done?

title: Is it possible to grow an orange tree in my backyard?
self_text: I live in central florida and have a big empty space that gets lots of sun, but the soil is kinda sandy. I'd like to plant some sort of fruit bearing tree there, and I think oranges would be pretty cool.

title: What are the differences between a dog's teeth and a human's teeth?
self_text: I can't think of any off the top of my head, but I'm sure there's some differences.   They both have canines, incisors, premolars, and molars, so what makes them different from us?  Also, why do dogs need to get their teeth cleaned by professionals instead of just brushing at home like we do?  What is it about a dog's mouth that makes it easier for plaque/tartar build up? Is it because they eat more meat or something?

title: How do I tell my parents that I’m getting fired?
self_text: My dad wants to help me find a job but I don’t want him to know because it makes me feel like a failure and he is not really good at helping people out so if he does try, it will probably make things worse.

title: Why is the sky blue?
self_text: I know its Rayleigh scattering but can you explain it to me like im 5

title: Why do people say “don’t let it happen again” when you tell them something bad?
self_text: When you tell someone something bad, they say “oh no! Don’t let it happen again!” Like what am I supposed to do? Prevent the bad thing from happening by willing it away with my mind?  I also hear people say that after an accident or injury too.

title: Why is it called a “dog year” if dogs don’t use years?
self_text: I understand why we call it that, but it still makes no sense to me.

title: How to tell if my dog is being nice or trying to manipulate me?
self_text: My dog, a 4 year old male jack russel mix, has been extra affectionate lately and I'm starting to wonder if he's trying to get something out of it. He usually doesn't like snuggles but will cuddle with me on the couch while I watch TV, which is very sweet, but also weird because he'll only do it when he wants something.  He does this when he knows his walk is coming up and/or he knows I'm about to eat something.  Is this him trying to be manipulative or is he just being friendly?  I don't want to think my cute little guy is using me for treats and walks!

title: How does the SpaceX Starship work?
self_text: I have a lot of questions about it so, can someone explain to me how it works?  What are the stages and what do they do? What's the purpose of the two boosters? How is it going to go to mars and back?  How much payload will be able to carry in total?   I would really appreciate any help!  Thanks!

title: Why is it called a side hustle?
self_text: I think that the term 'side hustle' implies that you do something on the side to make money, but it's not your main source of income or job. But if you spend more time working on your side hustle than you do your actual job, then shouldn't it be called a full-time hustle instead? And why isn't it?

title: How do I become a millionaire by the age of 20?
self_text: I’m not sure if it’s possible but I have to try and reach that goal for myself! I am currently trying to find ways to make money, start my own business or invest in something big. Any advice is appreciated!

title: Why is there so much more hype around the Super Bowl compared to other sports’ championships?
self_text: I know it's because of all the commercials, celebrity appearances and halftime show but that stuff happens at all the big games in every sport. So why does the Super Bowl get so much attention?

title: What is the difference between a "Cousin" and a "Second Cousin"?
self_text: My grandfather had two children, my father and an aunt. I have no idea how to distinguish between first cousins and second cousins but it's always come up when I'm talking with my family.  I can't find any reliable sources online so figured this was a good place to ask.

title: What's the deal with the name "Taco Bell"?
self_text: Why would someone start a restaurant called Taco Bell? It sounds like they sell tacos and bells, not tacos in a bell.

title: Why is it that all the other people who were in space also have to be astronauts?
self_text: I thought they would just hire a civilian like me or someone with no background in aviation but maybe I’m wrong idk.  Why can’t civilians go into space?

title: How to tell if a dog is good with kids?
self_text: My family wants a dog and my little brother thinks that all dogs love everyone, especially children. I have told him multiple times that’s not true but he won’t listen.   How do I convince him otherwise?  Also, how can we tell whether or not the dog will be good with kids (my mom has two of them) before adopting it?  I don’t want us getting a dog just for it to bite someone because they are annoying it.  We also have a cat so it must be good with cats as well.

title: What's the difference between a comet and an asteroid?
self_text: I've always thought they were both big space rocks but my friend said that comets are made of ice, which is weird since it's so hot in space.

title: Is it possible to use a dog's fur for clothing?
self_text: Not like I'm going to shave my dogs and make clothes out of them, but could you?  Would the fabric be soft or itchy? Could it be made into yarn?  What would be the process? Would they grow back?

title: What is a good name for a cat?
self_text: It's a male and he's black, white, brown and orange

title: What does it mean when you're “banned” from a place?
self_text: I was walking down the street today and saw a guy talking to a police officer in front of a grocery store. He said he got banned from the grocery store but didn’t say why.  Is that like, you can never enter again? Or is it for a certain amount of time? And what happens if you go anyway? Do they arrest you?

title: How can I find the source of a bad smell in my car?
self_text: My car smells like vinegar, and it’s coming from the AC vents, but only when I turn on the AC. I’ve tried to clean out any debris I could find, but nothing seems to be working. Is there anything else I should try?

title: How do you make a good first impression on your future wife?
self_text: I know that sounds kinda weird, but hear me out, I’m just trying to figure out what makes a person want to be with another person for the rest of their life, so if you were in my shoes and got the chance to meet your future wife for the first time, how would you go about it?

title: How do I get my dog to stop being so scared of the sky?
self_text: He is a 2 year old small poodle and has been doing it for about a month now. We just moved from California to Florida, could that be why he's so nervous when its cloudy or thundering?  Any advice would be appreciated.

title: Why do some people say "It's a gift and a curse" when they can draw or sing?
self_text: I think it’s because there is a lot of pressure to always be drawing/singing whenever someone finds out you can, which sucks for us who are introverted and don’t like being the center of attention. Also if you want to make a career out of it then you have to deal with criticism all the time, even from family and friends.   I think that would suck so bad.

title: How do you get a dog?
self_text: Do you go to a shelter or buy from someone like petco?

title: Why does a dog get jealous?
self_text: I love my dog, he's the best and so cute but sometimes I feel like he gets jealous when I give attention to other people or pets, is that even possible for a dog to do? Or am I just overthinking it?

title: How to get the smell of burning rubber out of a car?
self_text: I got into an accident and my tire rubbed against the fender. It smells like burnt rubber in the car. The smell is still there even after I've cleaned everything with soap and water. Is it possible that the smell will eventually go away or do I need to take it to a mechanic/car wash for them to remove the smell?

title: What is the difference between a black hole and the center of the universe?
self_text: I know what a black hole is, but when you get close enough to it, everything disappears. And isn't that like what happened during the Big Bang?

title: Why is it that all sports teams have a "mascot"?
self_text: How did this start and why does it continue? It doesn't seem like there's any competitive advantage to having a mascot, so I don't understand the point.  Edit: What do you mean "competitive advantage" is being able to sell more merchandise or get more fans? That makes sense for businesses, but sports teams aren't supposed to be about making money, they're supposed to be about playing games. And if that's true then it's just corporate greed.

title: What is the best way to get a job at Tesla?
self_text: I want to be an engineer there but don't know where to start, what schools do they like and what jobs are available that have little or no experience? I also can't move anywhere due to my current financial situation so I'm stuck in Nevada.

title: Why is it called “Blue Cross Blue Shield”?
self_text: I heard they are a insurance company and the logo has blue and white colors, but what does “Cross” mean? Does it have to do with the Red Cross or something?

title: Why does a certain brand of dog food make my dog gassy?
self_text: I recently switched my dog to Purina Pro Plan and it seems like he's been farting up a storm ever since! Could this be due to the protein source? Or something else entirely? I'm looking for an alternative brand that will hopefully have fewer ingredients, as well as better quality and digestibility so that his gas subsides.  He's also on some supplements that may or may not contribute (his vet said they were fine). Any suggestions are appreciated!

title: What is a good name for a male dog?
self_text: I'm getting a male husky and i don't know what to call him, any ideas?  (I can't do names from movies or tv)

title: Why is it a crime to steal from corporations but not an ethical problem?
self_text: Or if it is, why isn't it more of one?  I think the answer is that it's both a crime and an ethical problem for individuals, but when it's a corporation, they can afford it and have insurance and don't care. But shouldn't we all be against stealing in general? I understand someone stealing food because they are hungry, but what about people who steal for fun or money? It doesn't matter whether they steal from a person or a company.

title: How does the company “The Rock” own a brand of tequila?
self_text: I’ve always known him as The Rock, but why does he have his own Tequila called Teremana? What is the origin of that name and how did it become so popular in such little time?  Is there some sort of connection between Dwayne Johnson, his family and Mexico or something like that?

title: What is a good way to find out if you have cancer?
self_text: I'm not trying to diagnose myself but my mom has cancer and so does my grandma and I want to make sure that I don't.  I've been feeling really tired for months now, even though I get enough sleep and eat well, and I also have a weird lump on my neck that feels hard and doesn't move around when I press it.   I know the only way to be certain is to see a doctor but I don't have insurance right now and can't afford to go to the hospital until after January 1st when my new job starts giving me benefits.  So what are some things I could do in the meantime to check if I might have cancer?

title: How did the first people get a tan?
self_text: I'm not talking about the first humans, but the first homo sapiens to leave Africa. They didn't have sunscreen, so how did they get a tan without getting sunburned?

title: Why does a lot of people say “I’m gonna make it” when they are already there?
self_text: I hear my parents and friends saying that often even though their goals have been met. Do you guys do that too?

title: Why is the name of a dog "dog"?
self_text: I'm pretty sure it has to be from when we domesticated them, because they probably just went by sounds or whatever but why did we choose dog?

title: What is the difference between a dog and a wolf?
self_text: I am starting to learn about animals and was wondering what exactly makes a dog a dog and not a wolf, or vice versa. Is it just that we domesticated dogs but wolves are wilder?  Also if you could tell me some of their similarities too that would be great.  Thank you for your time.

title: Is it normal for a puppy to be shy when first meeting people?
self_text: He's very energetic and loves everyone once he gets comfortable, but seems really nervous around strangers at first.  I just want to make sure I'm doing everything right.

title: Why does my dog have a black tongue?
self_text: I just got him from the shelter yesterday and his tongue is fully black!  I've never seen a dog with a black tongue before, so I was wondering if it's normal or if he has some sort of disease/illness. He seems perfectly healthy otherwise; good appetite, energy level, no symptoms of anything wrong.  Any help would be appreciated!  Thanks in advance.

title: What are the different kinds of dogs that have the ability to jump really high?
self_text: I know a husky and a Jack Russell terrier can jump over my head but I don't know what other breeds can do it.  I guess bigger dogs might be able to jump over someone too if they put their mind into it, like German shepherds or golden retrievers.   I also wonder how much weight they could carry while jumping.

title: What is the most common way to get scammed?
self_text: Or, what scam has gotten you or someone you know? I have never been scammed and want to learn how scammers think so that I can avoid them.

title: How is a company that sells a product with an unlimited lifetime warranty not going bankrupt?
self_text: I understand that most people will never take advantage of the warranty, but some people are always going to abuse it.

title: Why is the name of my ISP (internet service provider) "Xfinity"?
self_text: I'm just a little confused on what it means or if it has any meaning?

title: Is it wrong to have a crush on someone who’s dating your friend?
self_text: I don't like my friend. She's very rude and always mean for no reason. But the guy she's with is nice, polite, and funny. I understand that he's her boyfriend so I won't do anything about it but still, I can't help having feelings for him.

title: What's the deal with the term "post"?
self_text: I understand what it means, but how did that come about?  Like, why are we calling these places posts now instead of just forums or boards?  I think it started when Reddit got big, but idk

title: Is there any way to get rid of a smell from an animal's fur?
self_text: My family recently adopted a dog who was found as a stray, and it seems like no matter how many times we bathe her she still smells bad, even after being brushed out. I figured it might be something lingering on her fur, so I tried all sorts of sprays and shampoos for getting rid of skunk or other animals’ odors, but nothing works. Is there anything else that will work? I'm worried about the dog smelling like this forever.   Is there any way to get rid of a smell from an animal's fur?

title: Why is the logo on the side of a rocket/space shuttle always facing up?
self_text: I’m not an engineer so excuse me if this sounds stupid, but why does the logo on the side of rockets and space shuttles always face up when they launch? Is it to do with how much stress it would take to keep it perfectly aligned or something else? (I know it’s probably just because people like seeing the logo, but that can’t be the only reason.)
